abstract: An implementation of Secure Hashing Algorithm 2 (SHA-2) hashing with a 512-bit digest.
overview:
## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SHA2_512] hash implements the [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/HashFunction] protocol for the specific case of SHA-2 hashing with a 512-bit digest ([doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SHA512Digest]). Larger digests take more space but are more secure.

You can compute the digest by calling the static `hash(data:)` method once. Alternatively, if the data that you want to hash is too large to fit in memory, you can compute the digest iteratively by creating a new hash instance, calling the `update(data:)` method repeatedly with blocks of data, and then calling the `finalize()` method to get the result.

# SHA2_512

**Type Alias**

An implementation of Secure Hashing Algorithm 2 (SHA-2) hashing with a 512-bit digest.

## Declaration

```swift
typealias SHA2_512 = SHA512
```

## Discussion

The [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SHA2_512] hash implements the [doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/HashFunction] protocol for the specific case of SHA-2 hashing with a 512-bit digest ([doc://com.apple.CryptoKit/documentation/CryptoKit/SHA512Digest]). Larger digests take more space but are more secure.

You can compute the digest by calling the static `hash(data:)` method once. Alternatively, if the data that you want to hash is too large to fit in memory, you can compute the digest iteratively by creating a new hash instance, calling the `update(data:)` method repeatedly with blocks of data, and then calling the `finalize()` method to get the result.
title: SHA2_512
